name: Cook the Book: Rosemary and Chile-Grilled Shrimp with Lemon Zest
description: Fairway's ten-year old seafood department is well-known as one of the freshest and best in New York. This is due In large part to head fishmonger Tony Maltese. Born and raised in Brooklyn, Tony was a fisherman long before he...
recipeIngredient: 1 pound medium shrimp (24 to 32 shrimp), peeled and deveined, tails left on
Fresh juice and zest of 1 lemon
3 to 4 fresh small red chile peppers, seeded and finely chopped
2 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped
Kosher or sea salt to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with the oil, lemon juice, chile peppers, rosemary, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Cover and refrigerate for 30 to 45 minutes.
Light the grill or heat a cast-iron frying pan over high heat until very hot. Remove the shrimp from the marinade and grill or sear them until just pink and opaque, about 1 minute per side.
Transfer the cooked shrimp to a platter. Sprinkle with the lemon zest and season with salt to taste. Serve immediately.
